title: Online Learning Platform for Polytechnic Diploma Students (Branches, Materials, MCQs, Search, Admin)

requirements.text: Create a coherent, modern, minimal educational UI theme (light colors, readable typography, clear spacing, card-based layouts) and apply it consistently across all pages with full responsiveness (mobile/tablet/desktop) and accessible contrast/focus states.

quotes:
Design Style:
Modern, minimal, educational theme
Light colors, readable fonts
Icons and cards for subjects and branches

acceptanceCriteria: All pages render correctly at common breakpoints (mobile ~375px, tablet ~768px, desktop ~1280px) without overflow or broken layouts.
Interactive elements have visible focus states and meet basic accessibility expectations (labels, keyboard navigation, contrast).
Branch/semester/subject content is presented using consistent cards, headings, and spacing.

requirements.text: Implement the core information architecture and navigation: Home, Branch (by branch), Semester (within branch), Subject (within semester), Study Materials, Question Papers, MCQ Practice, Syllabus Overview, Search Results, Login/Register, Admin Panel.

quotes: Home page with course categories by branch and semester

Each branch should have:
Subject-wise study materials (PDF notes)
Previous years’ exam question papers
MCQs with answers
Syllabus overview
Admin panel to upload notes, papers, and MCQs

acceptanceCriteria: Users can navigate from Home → Branch → Semester → Subject pages.
Each Subject page provides tabs/sections for Notes (PDF), Question Papers, MCQs, and Syllabus Overview.
Navigation is usable on mobile (e.g., responsive header/menu).

requirements.text: Model and display the supported branches: Computer Engineering, IT, Mechanical, Electrical, Civil, Electronics, and Automobile, including branch landing pages that list semesters and subjects.

quotes: The website should support branches such as Computer Engineering, IT, Mechanical, Electrical, Civil, Electronics, and Automobile.
Home page with course categories by branch and semester

acceptanceCriteria: Home page shows all listed branches as selectable cards.
Each branch page shows semester list and (when selected) subjects for that semester.
Branch names are user-facing in English exactly as provided (or common abbreviations only if also shown alongside full names).

requirements.text: Implement student authentication using Internet Identity and store a user profile record on first login; support a basic Register/Login UX that uses Internet Identity and shows logged-in state in the UI.

quotes: Login/Register for students

acceptanceCriteria: Users can sign in and sign out using Internet Identity.
On first successful sign-in, a user profile record is created in the backend keyed by Principal.
UI clearly indicates whether the user is logged in (e.g., account menu / sign-in button).

requirements.text: Implement role-based access control for an Admin Panel: only authorized admin principals can access admin routes and perform upload/manage actions; unauthorized users are blocked from admin UI actions.

quotes: Admin panel to upload notes, papers, and MCQs

acceptanceCriteria: Admin routes/components are not accessible to non-admin users (redirect or show access denied).
Backend enforces admin-only mutations (cannot be bypassed by calling the canister directly).
Provide a backend method to list current admins and to add/remove admins (admin-only).

requirements.text: Create backend data models and CRUD endpoints for: branches, semesters, subjects, notes (PDF), question papers (PDF), MCQs (question, options, correct answer, optional explanation), and syllabus overview text/structure.

quotes: Database for storing users, study materials, and MCQs

Each branch should have:
Subject-wise study materials (PDF notes)
Previous years’ exam question papers
MCQs with answers
Syllabus overview

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes query methods to list branches/semesters/subjects and to fetch subject details.
Backend exposes admin-only update methods to create/update/delete notes, papers, MCQs, and syllabus overview entries.
Data is persisted across canister upgrades using stable storage patterns.

requirements.text: Implement study materials (PDF notes) module: subject-wise listing, file upload via Admin Panel, metadata (title, branch, semester, subject, year/term, tags), and a download action for students.

quotes: Subject-wise study materials (PDF notes)
Download option for notes and question papers
Admin panel to upload notes, papers, and MCQs

acceptanceCriteria: Students can view a list of notes for a selected subject and download a PDF.
Admins can upload a new PDF note and see it appear in the subject’s notes list.
Each note shows at least title and relevant academic context (branch/semester/subject) in the UI.

requirements.text: Implement previous years’ exam question papers module: subject-wise listing, file upload via Admin Panel, metadata (year, exam type/term if provided), and download action.

quotes: Previous years’ exam question papers
Download option for notes and question papers

acceptanceCriteria: Students can view a list of question papers for a selected subject and download a PDF.
Admins can upload question papers and manage (edit/delete) entries.
UI supports basic filtering/sorting by year when multiple papers exist.

requirements.text: Implement MCQ features: (1) browse MCQs with answers and explanations (if provided), (2) MCQ practice mode that randomizes or sequences questions, captures user selections, and displays score at the end.

quotes: MCQs with answers
MCQ practice section with score display

acceptanceCriteria: Students can browse MCQs for a subject and reveal correct answers.
Practice mode allows answering a set of MCQs and shows a final score (e.g., X/Y) and optionally a review of incorrect questions.
MCQs are stored and managed via Admin Panel (add/edit/delete).

requirements.text: Implement syllabus overview pages per subject (or per branch/semester when applicable) and show them in a clear, readable format on the subject page.

quotes: Syllabus overview

acceptanceCriteria: Each subject can display a syllabus overview section (structured text or headings) retrieved from the backend.
Admins can update syllabus content for a subject in the Admin Panel.
Syllabus content is readable and responsive, using consistent typography.

requirements.text: Add a global search bar that searches across subjects, notes, question papers, and MCQs; show categorized results and allow navigation to the relevant subject/content.

quotes: Search bar to find subjects, papers, or MCQs quickly

acceptanceCriteria: Typing a query returns results that include matches from subjects, notes, papers, and MCQs.
Search results are grouped or labeled by type (e.g., Subjects / Notes / Papers / MCQs).
Selecting a result navigates to the relevant page (subject detail or specific content listing).

requirements.text: Ensure the app is simple, fast-loading, and accessible: use efficient client-side data fetching/caching, show loading/empty/error states, and avoid unnecessary large assets on initial load.

quotes: Simple, fast-loading, and accessible design

acceptanceCriteria: All data-driven screens have explicit loading and error UI states.
Repeated navigations reuse cached data where appropriate (no excessive refetching).
No page depends on downloading large PDFs just to render the listing UI (PDFs download only on user action).

requirements.text: Add static generated icons/illustrations for the seven branches and display them on branch cards and/or headers.

quotes: Icons and cards for subjects and branches

acceptanceCriteria: The seven branch icons are present in frontend/public/assets/generated and are used in the UI.
Icons are visually consistent (same style, stroke/filled treatment, and sizing) and remain clear on light backgrounds.
Branch cards show icon + branch name in a clean, modern layout.

constraints: Use React + TypeScript with Tailwind and React Query on the frontend.
Use a single Motoko actor backend; do not introduce additional backend services.
Authentication must use Internet Identity (no third-party auth providers).
Do not edit frontend paths listed as immutable by the platform (compose UI using existing components instead).
All user-facing text must be in English.
nonGoals: Integrate Firebase, Node.js, PHP, or any external database/cloud backend outside the Internet Computer.
Implement real-time chat, push notifications, email/SMS messaging, or social media integrations.
